result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwin M. Guzman-Galarza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court deems the sentence time served.
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:38 AM Defendant Edwin M. Guzman-Galarza appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Edwin M. Guzman-Galarza.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The parties have reached a joint recommendation. Rights explained. Count 2, Misdemeanor Bail Jumping as repeater, No contest plea entered.  Convicted. Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in. Parties comment. Court sentences defendant to thirty (30) days Manitowoc County Jail, under the Huber Law. The Court deems the sentence time served as the defendant has twenty-nine (29) days sentence credit.  Court imposes costs of $443.00 to be paid by 11-01-2022 or  9days jail for failure to pay.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.
Motion hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Prior: Transient, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. misdemeanor bail jumping and obstruct officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-11-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
